metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0244 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sys_recvfrom function in nmbd in Samba 3.6.x before 3.6.24, 4.0.x before 4.0.19, and 4.1.x before 4.1.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via a malformed UDP packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
python-samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
registry-tools - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-libs - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
smbclient - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
winbind - 2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2').
